intro: Gymnadenia albida f. minor, commonly known as the lesser white gentian, is a rare and delicate flowering plant belonging to the Gentianaceae family. It is characterized by its small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodland floors and meadows. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in many regions.
